channel.title: ∫ research on kian orr
channel.description: Recent content in ∫ research on kian orr

item.title: particle in cell from scratch
item.description: This code was made for the final project of a computational physics class at UCLA. It was my introduction to computational plasma physics.

item.title: concert hall simulation
item.description: This simulation attempts to recreate the distribution of sound in square concert halls. The set-up is seen in the figure below, where the radii are calculate through geometry The radii come out to be $$\begin{aligned} r_1 &= d_1 \sqrt{\left(\frac{y}{2d_1-x}\right)^2 + 1} \\ r_3 &= d_3 \sqrt{\left(\frac{y}{2d_1+x}\right)^2 + 1} \\ r_2 &= \sqrt{\left(\frac{y(2d_1-x)}{d_1}\right)^2 + (d_1 - x)^2} \\ r_4 &= \sqrt{\left(\frac{y(2d_1+x)}{d_1}\right)^2 + (d_1 + x)^2} \\ r_5 &= \sqrt{x^2 + y^2} \end{aligned}.

item.title: large plasma device at UCLA
item.description: a picture of the large plasma device Most of my research done at UCLA is summarized in a poster: Survery Spectroscopy in the Large Plasma Device. I presented this poster at APS DPP 2022.

item.title: TAE
item.description: TAE is a company attempting fusion with an field reversed configuration (FRC) device. I can’t get into specifics, but I’m in the spectroscopy group working on a spectrometer diagnostic and it’s post-shot processing code, as well as a separate machine learning project.
